comments.commentBody:
Great to have Bill Walton back; I hope to hear him broadcast again.
Agree wholeheartedly that the Knicks should emulate organizations like the Yankees and the Lakers who repeatedly come up with the best players ever in their respective sports. Why can the Lakers get the very best centers of 4 different periods (Mikan, Chamberlain, Abdul-Jabbar, and O'Neill) PLUS other top of the line players like West, Baylor, Luke Walton, and Kobe Bryant while the Knicks get an endless series of turkeys?
The very best NY Knick teams did not have the best players in the league. Why not continue with that formula and recruit and retain intelligent, skillful players whose whole is greater than the sum of their parts? Forget the super stars; instead keep and develop players like Lee and Gallanari.
Look forward to hearing more from you, Bill.
What a complete joke.  Our financial system really does rest on a house of cards.  I think the controls in a Vegas casino are superior to what goes on on Wall St.

The stock market action today reminds me of the NASDAQ's swings back in March 2000.

I fear the volatility is a sign that stocks are going to suffer terrible losses in the near future.

The massive amount of stock sold was most likely a naked short, but the watchdogs at The SEC can't be expected to pull themselves away from their pornfest long enough to enforce the law, or even find the culprit. After all, they're not there to protect us, their job is to protect The Hedge Fund Goons.

@2: "It will be harder and harder for individual invester to compete with faster and faster computer trading systems."

Not true. All "computer trading systems" are still created by humans, who always make mistakes. The same as a century ago, greed and fear still rule even in the computer age. Always will.

How are we to know that this sort of thing, to a less drastic extent, doesn't happen frequently and account for many of the smaller sudden market declines? Only the severity of this one called anyone's attention to it. And it would be surprising that this sort of error was really not a lot more frequent than imagined. Hard to believe that this stuff is legal.....
Somewhere there is a hacker who made millions I'm sure...

I found it quite interesting that in the immediate aftermath of the drop, you guys lined up all kinds of "experts" who attributed this to the credit crisis in Greece or otherwise had all kinds of "market fundamentals" type theories. Makes one wonder if anyone on Wall Street knows what they are talking about.

I'm trying to figure out how "billions" were lost.  If anyone lost, it's the suckers who pushed the market down.  What speaks to the true efficiency of these electronic markets is how fast it all recovered.  Down 700 and back in 15 minutes... back where we started. So, how then are billions lost if the market ended where it started? If people sold down there, that means others bought down there.  The average investor probably didn't know about it until it was all over, and suffered no ill effect.

I hate AX too.  Not only are they more expensive and you have to wait longer for the funds but they will give their clients charge backs without questions. I can fax in a perfectly good, signed contract stating that we don't give refunds (bold, underlined and large), an email from the client stating that they really enjoyed the classes that they took and learned a lot but they decided to go to Europe so won't be finishing and I'll still loose and they'll take all the money for the classes including the one that the client took.  I only take AX if I have to.

Ben,

You're a talented reporter and I welcome you to the long and large Yankee cast.

The Yanks had a trove of broadcasting talentin the late 40s; at one time, Mel Allen was flanked by Russ Hodges who went on to WMCA to do the Giants' games and Curt Gowdy who settled in Boston. And of course the great Red Barber came along in the early 50s.

But I remember reading some time ago Harwell was also a member of the Yankee team at that time before moving to Detroit. None of the obits mentioned that but I am pretty confident it's a fact.

But I remember reading some years ago that Harwell was also a member of Allen team for a brief time. Do some research.

Fred Willman
fbenjul@hotmail.com

comments.commentTitle: This was a great show but then I was only 12 at the time
comments.commentBody: this was a great show but anyone i ever ask/tell about it thinks i'm crazy or doesn't even remember it. glad there is atleast this to prove it existed not only in my mind.

I agree with Frank re: treating your employees well translates to better sales and loyalty. We took over April 1st, quickly implementing hats and shirts with our logo. We stand behind our guys: if a customer starts giving lip or complaining about the bill, we immediately get on the phone to intervene, and if all else fails, we pull the guys off. Although most folks are perfectly nice and reasonable, we vehemently guard against their being taken advantage of. And the employees appreciate it.

One easy way to create loyalty is the simple follow-up call. We try to reach each customer on the same day they receive service. How did things go? Did the crew arrive on time? Any other feedback you have for us? The simple art of shutting your mouth and listening--often writing down their comments--will translate to higher sales in the long term, I believe.

And the compliments for our crews always go on the compliment board. The employees beam with pride, which as Frank noted translates to happier employees making happier customers who return.

Hey George,
A stroke is baseball language, too. A recent quote in the Times from Nick Swisher: I don’t,” Swisher said. “I guess I’m a road warrior. But I do know that on the road, it seems like I get my stroke going on the road. And I think that’s one thing I’ve got to be strong enough mentally to keep that same stroke here.”

drew has always been a dud - ask any phillie, cardinal or dodger fan - a crybaby, a lazy player, grossly overrated, not the least by himself.  And beltran had one spectacular flourish in his career - conveniently and shrewdly with Houston in the playoffs, just before he became a free agent.  Neither is worth turning the channel to see, let alone go to the ballpark to [not] see.

Pettite is one of the best in compensating for a day without his stuff and in picking off runners at first,
It may be my imagination but the team fields best behind him. This may be due to his selection of pitches to throw, to whom and in what situation,,,,,,,,,, a very important under emphasized skill.

As a resident of California, I'm witnessed the economic damage caused to our state by Sen. Boxer and the Democrats who control the legislature.  Employee unions have done immense harm to our once thriving environment.  I'm a Chuck Devore supporter, but I'll be happy to support Carli Fiorina over Boxer.  Madame Boxer has done so little, demanded so much, and has generally harmed small business people like me in the process.

#2 - nmetro

As a "working American," I'm absolutely sick and tired of paying the bills of government employees, welfare recipients, and Democrat constituencies. I don't think you got the memo...Democrats receive more campaign contributions than Republicans.

Carly and Sarah have a lot in common...Fiorina was a failure as the head of H-P and "Half-Term Quitter" was a failure as the head of Alaska. Both H-P and Alaska were left in worse shape by their incompetence.

One of the reasons our President is a socialist is that there are a lot of socialist voters in the U.S.  After the collapse of the USSR, a lot of these folks are slow to pick up on the news that socialism doesn't work.  Hopefully, they will learn a lesson from the damage socialist Greece is now doing to our stock market.

Steve Bolger,
Cynical Americans often forget that there are still people around that do things because it's the right thing, to do.
Sadly, few to none of " those people " are politicians anymore.
Some people do the right thing for selfish motives.. Some more selfish than others..

As for me, My daughter is highly allergic to dust and mold, She literaly can not breath under some circumstances. My physical illnesses are due to exposure to hazardous materials I came in contact with... Hence my vocal passion and interest in the business of clean air and water products..The air and water in my house is cleaner than a hospital setting.

The breakthroughs in this technology lends itself nicely to the recovery systems refining systems and scrubbing systems I've lent a hand in developing and maintain regularly. these products are working field tested and ready for use in times of trouble like oil spills , hot ash clouds from volcanic eruptions, radiation, even Katrina like disasters , where immediate drinking water, clean air, or recovery could mean the difference between life or death. Why these products are marginalized out, overlooked, and ridiculed by the very people who claim to care is beyond my comprehesion and better left for the Cynical, as I would really rather not have an opinion on that matter...
Or in other words , Don't ge me started...lol

Not all selfish motives end badly...Its those who practice the art of deception, curruption, and greed to achieve the goals of their selfish motives the cynical, should attach the blame to.
whether they are ones peers or adversary's

Theres always varying degees of right defined by perspective, Wrong by deception. curruption , or greed is always dead wrong.

Agreed, Nacho.

The Southern Politic is alive and well in Arizona:
It's not your (old white guys) fault
It is illegal immigrants' fault
The Tea Partying GOP is here to set things right as they always have before

Fixing the problem would be to hit crime-committing businesses hard and introducing temporary work visa program; but it never really is about fixing anything when the GOP is involved.

Please.

Sarah Palin hasn't had an original thought for years. She was told by the Republican muckity-mucks to endorse Fiorina, because of the three candidates only Fiorina stands a chance of upsetting Barbara Boxer.

As for these Tea Party candidates, I think Tony the Tiger has more to offer than any I've seen or heard.

Republicans are calling some candidates "Young Guns"? "Guns"?

How long will it take leftists in Congress and their press secretaries in the Washington/New York/American press corps to denounce the Republicans for a "racist campaign" to promote "violence" against blacks, hispanics, homosexuals, ...? 10, 9, 8, 7, ....

As I watch the markets crumble...Still based on housing....I don't know.............I think the idea of BIG is good, but should not be the biggest is always the best.......
Maybe it should be examined closely by those economists who were laughed at when they called the housing and mortgage crises........
